intro: Corispermum pilosum, commonly known as the hairy sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in compact inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments through its succulent leaves and deep root system. Corispermum pilosum is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is considered a pioneer species in disturbed habitats.
